image.altText: A grass strip next to a road with multiple bouquets of flowers and a wooden cross.

props.synopsis: The ACT Children's Court heard the 15-year-old boy accused of driving a stolen car that crashed and fatally injured another teenager near State Circle in April has allegedly been on a crime spree in the four months since.

title.children: Canberra teenager who allegedly drove stolen car involved in fatal crash denied bail

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: A judge who calculated former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell's sentence for child sex abuse on a maximum sentence much higher than what applied at the time of the offences is urged to maintain the over 13-year sentence anyway.

title.children: Canberra judge urged to maintain convicted child sex offender's 13-year sentence

image.altText: A woman in a race wheelchair

props.synopsis: This year's Paralympics play host to more female athletes than ever before — but putting together quotas and prioritising medal events has been described as "the biggest jigsaw puzzle".

title.children: Upcoming Paris Paralympics are the most gender-inclusive games in the competition’s 64-year history

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: 62-year-old Stipe Antunovic is accused of driving the woman from a shopping mall to a park, where the woman told police she'd been sexually assaulted.

title.children: Canberra man released on bail after allegedly raping a woman, then stealing her shopping

image.altText: A building with mult-coloured exterior.

props.synopsis: New details emerge about the chaotic scenes in the mental health unit at Canberra Hospital when 38-year-old Dusko Culibrk was allegedly murdered by a fellow patient.

title.children: Man who died in Canberra Hospital mental health unit sustained blunt force head and neck injuries, court documents reveal

image.altText: A man stands in front of a flower bed in full bloom.

props.synopsis: Flowers planted for Canberra's Floriade festival are blooming weeks ahead of schedule due to warmer weather, while commercial horticulturalists are having to adapt their planting to meet the changing seasons.

title.children: No, it's not your imagination. Spring has arrived weeks earlier and gardeners are having to adapt

props.synopsis: Canberra is grappling with the stubbornly high cost of housing, and many of the factors are out of the government's control — but it can control the types of properties added to the city's supply to cater for our growing population.

title.children: More people are living in the bush capital, but how well can they afford it?

image.altText: ACT missing person Laura Haworth. Missing since 2008.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother-of-two Laura Haworth was 23 years old when she was last seen at her friend's house in Queanbeyan more than 16 years ago.

title.children: Laura Haworth has been missing for more than 16 years. Police are hoping a $500,000 reward will deliver answers

image.altText: Group of protesters with one holding a sign 'right to strike'.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of tradies across the country have walked off the job in protest against the federal government's takeover of the construction arm of the CFMEU.

title.children: Prime minister warns of 'consequences' as thousands of CFMEU workers strike across Australia

image.altText: Boeing starliner

props.synopsis: With NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded aboard the ISS for months, a decorated former astronaut tells the ABC they would know and have trained for the risks but the view is definitely worth it.

title.children: NASA's astronauts now aboard the ISS face 'untold consequences' for their future

image.altText: A graphic of two women in graduation outfits, against a purple background with a red graph line over the top.

props.synopsis: The international education market is big business, particularly in Australia. As the government moves forward with the most significant crackdown on the sector in decades, we take a look at just how massive the industry really is.

title.children: The true scale of Australia's international student industry — in four charts

image.altText: A close-up of a customer pumping fuel into a car at a service station.

props.synopsis: Escalating geopolitical tensions threaten to send the price of oil soaring and it could mean bad news for Australians at the petrol pump.

title.children: The price of oil spiked overnight amid global tensions. What does it mean for Australian motorists?

image.altText: A charred vehicle sits in a field of green grass.

props.synopsis: The most aggressive and dominant ethnic Baloch armed group has launched a highly organised series of attacks on police stations, railway lines and highways as part of its fight for independence and to push out Chinese-backed projects.

title.children: Who are the 'anarchy' seeking militants who launched Operation 'Dark Windy Storm' in Pakistan?

image.altText: A man in a cap, with a whistle in his mouth points directly at the camera. It is night and another police officer is behind him.

props.synopsis: As the Middle East teeters on the precipice of regional war, ABC's Four Corners went where few Western journalists are allowed and got a glimpse of the regime's power.

title.children: Our trip inside Iran was a closely managed affair, then we got a glimpse of the regime's control

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a man with short hair looking downwards while walking outside.

props.synopsis: A sex predator who pretended to be a teenage YouTube star to blackmail hundreds of children into performing sexual acts is sentenced to 17 years in jail.

title.children: 'No comparable case': Man who posed as fake Youtube star to lure children into performing sex acts jailed for 17 years

image.altText: SES boat in a flooded street in Maribyrnong.

props.synopsis: Government action is needed to stop flood victims worn out from fighting long battles with insurers from accepting unfair cash settlements for their damaged homes, the author of a new report says.

title.children: Calls to protect flood victims from low ball cash offers from insurers

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue burqa covering shields her eyes from the sun and camera while she walks in the street

props.synopsis: Virtue laws introduced by the Taliban ban women from speaking or showing their faces in public as a senior UN official called it an extension of the "already intolerable restrictions" on Afghan women.

title.children: 'Sound of a female voice' banned in public across Afghanistan as UN decries virtue laws

image.altText: A family sits on a mat inside a subway, with a young girl with her hair plaited looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: First-hand accounts of the latest attack on Kyiv detail sirens blaring for 10 hours and explosions overhead, as Russia targets the country's power grid.

title.children: Ukrainians emerge from shelters to find cities plunged into darkness after latest Russian attack

image.altText: A close-up of Emmanuel Macron frowning.

props.synopsis: France's Socialist and Greens parties will not participate in further talks with President Emmanuel Macron to agree on the country's new prime minister, their leaders say.

title.children: 'This election is being stolen from us': France's left refuses talks after prime minister nominee rejected

image.altText: Winds lash drivers on Sorell Causeway.

props.synopsis: Wild winds are lashing Tasmania as a cold front crosses the island, with the severe weather predicted to last into Wednesday.

title.children: Severe weather lashes Tasmania as winds cut power and rains set to bring flooding

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair, and wearing a sleeveless top, smiles for the camera in a head-and-shoulders photo.

props.synopsis: Kelly Wilkinson told her sister she feared for her life and wanted "someone to know" she'd allegedly been repeatedly raped by her estranged husband Brian Earl Johnston. A court has heard he admitted to the offences, saying he'd been drunk.

title.children: Kelly Wilkinson's killer Brian Earl Johnston faces committal over rape charges

image.altText: A construction site next to an oak tree.

props.synopsis: A Sydney property developer lodged an appeal in court after being fined $3,000 by City of Canterbury Bankstown for destroying an oak tree. A council officer found excavation work at the builder's Revesby construction site had compromised the structural stability of the tree.

title.children: Sydney developer fined $45,000 after trying to appeal $3,000 council fine for destroying tree

image.altText: Oasis credit Dave Hogan GettyImages

props.synopsis: After 15 years of trading insults and refuting any suggestion they might reform, Liam and Noel Gallagher will reunite Oasis to headline a series of live shows next year.

title.children: Bad blood tore Oasis apart. Now big concert dates will reunite them

image.altText: GINDORAN2

props.synopsis: Ambulance officers who were injured in a Bruce Highway crash continued to carry out their duties to treat five people also involved.

title.children: 'Chaotic' truck crash scene keeps major highway closed

image.altText: A map showing the location of Tarawera.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the death of a 25-year-old experienced skydiver at Tarawera, near Goondiwindi, after his landing went wrong.

title.children: Skydiver with more than 600 jumps dies after landing accident in south-west Queensland

image.altText: Two satellite images side by side from 2020 and 2024. The latter shows an area of forest has been cleared.

props.synopsis: European supermarkets won't buy beef from Brazil due to concerns about land clearing in the Amazon. Now conservationists are urging Coles and Woolworths to follow suit to combat deforestation in Australia.

title.children: 16,000 hectares of forests found flattened on beef farms and 'people don't even know it's happening'

image.altText: A woman with an umbrella walks in the University of Sydney quadrangle.

props.synopsis: Education Minister Jason Clare has announced his much-anticipated overall limit for international students starting in 2025, with individual caps to be set for providers.

title.children: International student commencements to be capped at 270,000 next year

image.altText: A machine with many yellow circles inside a white background.

props.synopsis: Scientists have yet to find evidence of WIMPs — one of the main contenders for dark matter — in the most sensitive test yet made. We explain what the new results mean.

title.children: The world's most sensitive detector has found no sign of dark matter. So where is it?

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie quiet about what potentially is looming as a future crisis point for the US economy. Neither party is addressing America's burgeoning debt levels and the yawning gap between its income and its outlays.

title.children: Trump and Harris go quiet on America's biggest economic issue

image.altText: Security personnel walk around a grandstand in front of cluttered chairs

props.synopsis: Members of a task force investigating the attempted assassination of former president Donald Trump visit the scene of the attack.

title.children: Weeks after attempted Trump assassination, task force has 'more questions than answers'

image.altText: Maya Joint smiles and holds her racquet

props.synopsis: Rising Australian tennis star Maya Joint may have a battle on her hands securing a $200,000 US Open payday because she's committed to a US college.

title.children: Aussie teen embroiled in prize money dilemma after breakthrough US Open win

image.altText: Ben O'Connor smiles and looks down

props.synopsis: Cyclist Ben O'Connor was painted as "irritating", "annoying" and unable to handle his emotions during the 2023 Tour de France. Now he's got the best chance imaginable to achieve his ultimate goal of winning a grand tour at the Vuelta a España.

title.children: Ben O'Connor's antics during the Tour de France were described as 'irritating'. Now he's leading the Vuelta a España

image.altText: Taylor Walker, Christian Petracca and Jake Stringer

props.synopsis: The premiership dreams of 10 clubs are officially over, but that doesn't mean their seasons are done. Here is a look at a to-do list for each of the teams that failed to qualify for this year's AFL finals.

title.children: Season over? Not quite — the big decisions facing each club that missed the AFL finals

image.altText: Alexa Leary smiles at the end of the pool

props.synopsis: Alexa Leary miraculously survived a cycling accident three years ago and is now poised to make her mark at the Paralympics, while wheelchair marathon champion Madison de Rozario is aiming to defend the gold she won in Tokyo.

title.children: The swimming and athletics stars you must watch at the Paris Paralympics

image.altText: Michael Voss holds his phone up as two people scramble out of a Mercedes Benz crashed sideways in a residential street.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne cafe owner has recounted the dramatic moment Carlton AFL coach Michael Voss gave chase to two young people who attempted to flee the scene of a mid-morning car crash near a school crossing.

title.children: Carlton AFL coach Michael Voss makes dramatic citizen's arrest of alleged car thief
